text:
"Crime and Punishment"

He was speaking to himself.  
“Blood? What blood?” he said, turning pale and looking at the wall.  

Nastasya kept looking at him without saying anything.  
“Nobody has hurt the landlady,” she finally said firmly.  

He stared at her, barely able to breathe.  
“I heard it myself... I wasn’t asleep... I was sitting up,” he said more quietly. “I listened for a long time. The assistant superintendent came... Everyone ran out into the hallway from all the apartments.”  

“No one has been here. That’s just the blood you hear in your head. When it gets stuck and doesn’t flow, you start imagining things... Do you want to eat something?”  

He didn’t answer. Nastasya continued to watch him.  
“Give me something to drink... Nastasya.”  

She went downstairs and came back with a white jug of water. He only remembered taking one sip of the cold water and spilling some on his neck. Then he forgot everything.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, in a feverish state, struggles with hallucinations and confusion about a supposed incident involving blood and the landlady.
